channel.description: Recent content in Telecommunications on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Emtek Logo Emtek is Indonesia’s second largest media group, as of 2013. Emtek is the parent company for subsidiaries which include terrestrial television subscription NexMedia and three television stations – SCTV, Indosiar and O Channel. PT. Elang Mahkota Teknologi was established in 1983 by Eddy Kusnadi Sariaatmadja. PT. Elang Mahkota Teknologi Indonesia is now headed by Alvin Widarta Sariaatmadja, President Director of the Emtek Group. Source
You can download theEmteklogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Emtek
item.description: Emtek is Indonesia’s second largest media group, as of 2013. Emtek is the parent company for subsidiaries which include terrestrial television subscription NexMedia and three television stations – SCTV, Indosiar and O Channel. PT. Elang Mahkota Teknologi was established in 1983 by Eddy Kusnadi Sariaatmadja. PT. Elang Mahkota Teknologi Indonesia is now headed by Alvin Widarta Sariaatmadja, President Director of the Emtek Group. item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Currys plc Logo
Dixons Carphone plc is a British multinational electrical and telecommunications retailer and services company headquartered in London, England. It was formed on 7 August 2014, by the merger of Dixons Retail and Carphone Warehouse Group. It is listed on the London Stock Exchange, and is a constituent of the FTSE 250 Index. The company operates under a number of brands in the United Kingdom, Ireland and mainland Europe. These include Currys PC World, Team Knowhow and Carphone Warehouse in the United Kingdom; Dixons Travel in airports in the United Kingdom, Ireland and Oslo; Currys PC World and Carphone Warehouse in the Republic of Ireland; Elkjøp in Norway; Elgiganten/Gigantti in the other Nordic countries; and Kotsovolos in Greece.
You can download theCurryslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Currys
item.description: Dixons Carphone plc is a British multinational electrical and telecommunications retailer and services company headquartered in London, England. It was formed on 7 August 2014, by the merger of Dixons Retail and Carphone Warehouse Group. It is listed on the London Stock Exchange, and is a constituent of the FTSE 250 Index. The company operates under a number of brands in the United Kingdom, Ireland and mainland Europe. These include Currys PC World, Team Knowhow and Carphone Warehouse in the United Kingdom; Dixons Travel in airports in the United Kingdom, Ireland and Oslo; Currys PC World and Carphone Warehouse in the Republic of Ireland; Elkjøp in Norway; Elgiganten/Gigantti in the other Nordic countries; and Kotsovolos in Greece.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Bouygues Logo Bouygues S.A. is an industrial group headquartered in the 8th arrondissement of Paris, France. Bouygues is listed on Euronext Paris exchange and is a blue chip in the CAC 40 stock market index. The company was founded in 1952 by Francis Bouygues and since 1989 has been led by his son Martin Bouygues. The group specialises in construction, real estate development, media, telecommunications and transportation. Source
You can download theBouygueslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.description: Bouygues S.A. is an industrial group headquartered in the 8th arrondissement of Paris, France. Bouygues is listed on Euronext Paris exchange and is a blue chip in the CAC 40 stock market index. The company was founded in 1952 by Francis Bouygues and since 1989 has been led by his son Martin Bouygues. The group specialises in construction, real estate development, media, telecommunications and transportation. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Sinclair Broadcast Group Logo
Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc. is a publicly traded American telecommunications conglomerate that is controlled by the descendents of company founder Julian Sinclair Smith. Headquartered in the Baltimore suburb of Cockeysville, Maryland, the company is the second-largest television station operator in the United States by number of stations, owning or operating a total of 193 stations across the country in over 100 markets, many of which are located in the South and Midwest, and is the largest owner of stations affiliated with Fox, ABC, and The CW.
You can download theSinclairlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Sinclair
item.description: Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc. is a publicly traded American telecommunications conglomerate that is controlled by the descendents of company founder Julian Sinclair Smith. Headquartered in the Baltimore suburb of Cockeysville, Maryland, the company is the second-largest television station operator in the United States by number of stations, owning or operating a total of 193 stations across the country in over 100 markets, many of which are located in the South and Midwest, and is the largest owner of stations affiliated with Fox, ABC, and The CW.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Trimble Navigation Logo Trimble Inc., headquartered in Sunnyvale, California, makes Global Positioning System receivers, laser rangefinders, unmanned aerial vehicles, inertial navigation systems and a variety of software processing tools. As of 2012, the company has 6561 employees who are located in about 30 countries. Since 1999, Trimble’s revenues have grown from approximately $270 million to over $2.0 billion in 2012. Source
You can download theTrimblelogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

As of 2012, the company has 6561 employees who are located in about 30 countries. Since 1999, Trimble’s revenues have grown from approximately $270 million to over $2.0 billion in 2012. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Charter Communication Logo
Charter Communications, Inc., is an American telecommunications and mass media company with services branded as Charter Spectrum. With over 26 million customers in 41 states, it is the second-largest cable operator in the United States by subscribers, just behind Comcast, and third-largest pay TV operator behind Comcast and AT&T. Charter is the fifth-largest telephone provider based on number of residential lines. In late 2012, with longtime Cablevision executive Thomas Rutledge named as their CEO, Charter relocated its corporate headquarters from St.
You can download theCharterlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

item.description: Charter Communications, Inc., is an American telecommunications and mass media company with services branded as Charter Spectrum. With over 26 million customers in 41 states, it is the second-largest cable operator in the United States by subscribers, just behind Comcast, and third-largest pay TV operator behind Comcast and AT&T. Charter is the fifth-largest telephone provider based on number of residential lines. In late 2012, with longtime Cablevision executive Thomas Rutledge named as their CEO, Charter relocated its corporate headquarters from St.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Jio Logo
Reliance Jio Infocomm Limited, doing business as Jio, is an Indian telecommunications company and a subsidiary of Jio Platforms, headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. It operates a national LTE network with coverage across all 22 telecom circles. It does not offer 2G or 3G service, and instead uses only voice over LTE to provide voice service on its 4G network. Jio soft launched on 27 December 2015 with a beta for partners and employees, and became publicly available on 5 September 2016.
You can download theJiologo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Jio
item.description: Reliance Jio Infocomm Limited, doing business as Jio, is an Indian telecommunications company and a subsidiary of Jio Platforms, headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. It operates a national LTE network with coverage across all 22 telecom circles. It does not offer 2G or 3G service, and instead uses only voice over LTE to provide voice service on its 4G network. Jio soft launched on 27 December 2015 with a beta for partners and employees, and became publicly available on 5 September 2016.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 American Telephone and Telegraph Company Logo
AT&T Inc. is an American multinational conglomerate holding company, Delaware-registered but headquartered at Whitacre Tower in Downtown Dallas, Texas. It is the world’s largest telecommunications company, the largest provider of mobile telephone services, and the largest provider of fixed telephone services in the United States through AT&T Communications. Since June 14, 2018, it is also the parent company of mass media conglomerate WarnerMedia, making it the world’s largest media and entertainment company in terms of revenue.
You can download theAT&Tlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: AT&T
item.description: AT&T Inc. is an American multinational conglomerate holding company, Delaware-registered but headquartered at Whitacre Tower in Downtown Dallas, Texas. It is the world’s largest telecommunications company, the largest provider of mobile telephone services, and the largest provider of fixed telephone services in the United States through AT&T Communications. Since June 14, 2018, it is also the parent company of mass media conglomerate WarnerMedia, making it the world’s largest media and entertainment company in terms of revenue.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Verizon Communications Logo
Verizon Communications Inc. is an American multinational telecommunications conglomerate and a corporate component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average. The company is based at 1095 Avenue of the Americas in Midtown Manhattan, New York City, but is incorporated in Delaware. In 1984, the United States Department of Justice mandated AT&T Corporation to break up the Bell System into seven companies, each a Regional Bell Operating Company, commonly referred to as “Baby Bells”.
You can download theVerizonlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
